content:
Getting an error "The image source 'icon-q-coding.png' cannot be resolved" from the IG publisher on the rendering of Questionnaire instance: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-bfdr/branches/master/qa.html#internal
No error a couple of days ago. There appear to be missing icons: image.png
@Grahame Grieve - do we need to add these to the template? If so, where's the official source for them?
it's on my todo list
Isn't that file in the pub pack?

pubpack has icon-q-choice as it was before, but there is not icon-q-coding.
I think we should add a file - I think it's not good to change the reference to the old icon-q-choice

Ah, this is for R5. So we can just copy the file over and be done?
No need for a new image - it's the same logical control.
That will be what R4 to R5 migrations will be doing in the concept map for upgrades of data.
Right, this is the same image - but I thought you wanted to suggest better images @Brian Postlethwaite
I presume if the image is duplicated in oubpack but with a different name, this will be gone (or whatever other magic applies here)
I fixed it temporarily by adding the png to my images folder
We already tweaked the worst ones to a set that was reasonable.
A PR into the pub pack is what's needed.

Brian Postlethwaite said:

We already tweaked the worst ones to a set that was reasonable.

... but the choice icon was not picked in that purge?
It was made a nicer version similar to a regular textbox icon.
Not too remove it
The one I saw was still the blue circle with white arrows
do you want to make that PR @Brian Postlethwaite ? I would, but it seems I'm not looking at the right place or I'm missing something
Ok, I'll dig it out a little later.
I'm running behind on questionnaire.
I'm on this one, will put a PR in a bit later.
I'm still getting this error - we're hoping to publish the IG that is getting the error soon. Can we get a pass on the error for publication?
Yes
Is there a status on the icon-q-choice problem? I am still getting errors in my IG. I don't want to make a temporary fix as suggested by @Jose Costa Teixeira if a permanent solution is comming soon.
what's the problem?
I think that is fixed now. @Kirstine Rosenbeck Gøeg do you have an IG that has an issue? Did you update your local publisher?

I am having the problem here: http://build.fhir.org/ig/hl7dk/KL-dk-tools/branches/main/qa.html, not in a local instance of the publisher. The error says: "The image source 'icon-q-coding.png' cannot be resolved". And as you can see here, the icon is not found: http://build.fhir.org/ig/hl7dk/KL-dk-tools/branches/main/Questionnaire-KLToolsCareWHO-5.html - I just assumed it was the same problem... but maybe not.
@Kirstine Rosenbeck Gøeg I think I was wrong, sorry for misleading
I thought I remember this being fixed but I can see other IGs also having the same issue
I don't know if the icon-q-coding.png is in the package, or if the issue is because this is a R4 questionnaire and the item type is not coding but choice.
Not sure the PR was made. and I was almost sure this had been handled.
this works for me - I just built main, after removing the additional icon-q-coding, and it built fine, no errors. Should I be looking for something?
I got the same error for a Questionnaire when running with a local IG publisher. Is it NOT an issue on the non-local IG publisher? Thanks. @Jose Costa Teixeira
did you update your local ig publisher?
Yes, I did update the local IG publisher. When I ran against the officer Publisher, the error went away. Thanks.
